channel.title: CVE Feed for Horner Automation -- Cscape
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Horner Automation -- Cscape

item.title: CVE-2023-28653|2023-06-06T16:42:49.346Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: The affected application lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., CSP). This could lead to a use-after-free vulnerability. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: CVE-2023-29503|2023-06-06T16:37:52.103Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: The affected application lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., CSP). This could lead to a stack-based buffer overflow. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: CVE-2023-32203|2023-06-06T16:23:54.359Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: The affected application lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., HMI). This could lead to an out-of-bounds write at CScape_EnvisionRV+0x2e374b. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: CVE-2023-32281|2023-06-06T15:15:17.540Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: The affected application lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., CSP). This could lead to an out-of-bounds read in the FontManager. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: CVE-2023-32539|2023-06-06T15:11:19.755Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: The affected application lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., HMI). This could lead to an out-of-bounds write at CScape_EnvisionRV+0x2e3c04. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to potentially execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: CVE-2023-32545|2023-06-06T14:51:49.298Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: The affected application lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., CSP). This could lead to an out-of-bounds read in Cscape!CANPortMigration. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: CVE-2023-32289|2023-06-06T15:13:13.877Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: The affected application lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g.., CSP). This could lead to an out-of-bounds read in IO_CFG. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: CVE-2023-27916|2023-06-06T16:39:46.317Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: The affected application lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing font files (e.g., FNT). This could lead to an out-of-bounds read. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to potentially execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: CVE-2023-31278|2023-06-06T16:25:34.270Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: The affected application lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., HMI). This could lead to an out-of-bounds read. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to potentially execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: CVE-2023-31244|2023-06-06T16:27:01.068Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: The affected product does not properly validate user-supplied data. If a user opens a maliciously formed CSP file, then an attacker could execute arbitrary code within the current process by accessing an uninitialized pointer.

item.title: CVE-2023-7206|2024-01-15T22:22:01.676Z -- horner%20automation -- cscape
item.description: In Horner Automation Cscape versions 9.90 SP10 and prior, local attackers are able to exploit this vulnerability if a user opens a malicious CSP file, which would result in execution of arbitrary code on affected installations of Cscape.
